name: Zataphruz

timeline_beats.label: Founding of clustered harbors and saltworks
Integration into regional merchant leagues (river-coastal trade link)
Rise of Augur Houses controlling navigation rites
Engaged in Great Naval War; later border gain via succession crisis of neighbor

factions.label: Grand Merchant Consortium
factions.influence_hint: dominant in trade policy and reagent import

factions.label: Tidebound Navy
factions.influence_hint: controls coastal defense, port licenses, naval law

factions.label: Augur Houses
factions.influence_hint: monopolize navigational auguries and ritual-port rites

factions.label: Reagent Syndics
factions.influence_hint: control scarce imported ritual reagents and pricing

factions.label: Harbor Clans Council
factions.influence_hint: local landed families, influence docks and militia

constraints: No instant resurrection or true life-replacement magics (world constraint)
Long-range mind influence is rare and institutionally banned (world constraint)
Navigational auguries cannot replace charts and seamanship; auguries require specialist Houses and material components (world constraint)
Ritual magic consumes scarce imported reagents or specialized labor; reagents are high-value trade goods (world constraint)
Combustion-derived industry limited; no high-pressure steam megatechs (world constraint)
Obligations under T1 (Open-Seas Treaty) and A1 (Maritime Trading League) constrain wartime naval action and trade tariffs
Vulnerability to reagent blockades must be considered in logistics and diplomacy
notes: Coastal, port-cluster polity with layered guild/naval power balance
Strategic dependence on reagent import routes; Reagent Quay is chokepoint
Augur Houses are politically powerful but rely on Guild and Reagent Syndics
Recent border gain (BC3) expanded saltflat resources; increased friction with neighbor factions (W4 legacy)
Naval capacity is regionally strong but constrained by treaty obligations and limited industrial scale
